tweet: ...we must all search for ways we can participate in making our nation, our communities and our gathering places safe again. We also owe our First Responders our love and appreciation as they risk their own lives day after day for all of us. (2/2)

Today each of those touched by the tragedy that unfolded at the West Freeway Church of Christ awoke to a terrible reality. As we continue to hold the families of the victims and members of the congregation in our prayers... (1/2)
Our prayers will be with the family and loved ones of the victims and with the first responders in their heroic efforts. (2/2)

I offer my deepest condolences to the victims and families affected by today’s tragedy at the West Freeway Church of Christ in White Settlement, Texas. Evil touched a sacred place of peace, and our community shares in your anger and sorrow. (1/2) http://www.dallasnews.com/news/crime/2019/12/29/2-dead-1-in-critical-condition-after-reported-shooting-at-church-in-white-settlement/ …

Appropriations bills fund our national defense, increase border security, support affordable quality health care, and much more! The Federal Government will shut down in 11 days if these bills aren’t signed into law.

When the House reconvenes today, our sole focus should be on passing the bills that fund our government. Unfortunately, Democrats remain consumed by political games.
